edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap
Class PatternGroup

java.lang.Object
  edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap.PatternGroup

public class PatternGroup
extends java.lang.Object

A PatternGroup is a collection of pattern fragments that are all waiting for the same next parser item to be recognized.

In effect, a PatternGroup behaves like a single normalized pattern. However, when advanced it sorts the new pattern fragments according to what they are waiting for and keeps those waiting for the same thing in a single group rather than splitting them all out separately.

Pattern groups were introduced to prevent redundant recognitions when a pattern split into several different normalized variants.

Author:
R. James Firby

isNormalized

public boolean isNormalized()
Predicate to tell if this pattern group is normalized or not.

A normalized pattern group has been massaged to be expecting a single recognizable parser item.

Returns:
Whether this pattern group has been normalized

getKey

public DMAPItem getKey()
Get the element that this normalized pattern group is waiting for.

Returns:

isDiscontinuous

public boolean isDiscontinuous()

advance

public java.util.Collection<PatternGroup> advance()
Advancing a pattern group moves it forward to the next base element that the parser should be looking for. Advancing a pattern generates only normalized results. Thus, advancing a pattern group may also generate an arbitrary number of new pattern groups.

Returns:
The new, advanced, normalized versions of this pattern group

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return the pattern group as a string
